7d40cc45a297.bio: Maker of words and other annoyances. Communicator for hire. Owner of Juju Eye Communications + publisher of The Hit Job. Twitter: (@thejujueye).

690461b78012.bio: My social experiment to gain followers anonymously by tweeting the funny. Ten is a lot, right?

4c6b5904ffa9.bio: Sports, Detroit, reading. That stuff propels me. Michigan/California

8ac7adbee04c.bio: Masters degree in writing. Formerly at SMU Guildhall for an M.I.T. in game design. Failing at Stand-Up Comedy et al. Contributor to: http://DallasBasketball.com

1a91689b2d7f.bio: You want lobster, I'll give ya Burger King!
1a91689b2d7f.name: Rowdy Roddy Pooper

paragraphs.name: f851
paragraphs.text: Gordon declined an interview request through an Eagles PR intermediary. Eagles director of public relations Derek Boyko declined comment. Several other members of the Eagles PR staff did not respond to interview requests or declined comment.

paragraphs.name: 248d
paragraphs.text: Cataldi: We absolutely hate each other when we’re competing. And then we immediately team up when necessity arises like this. What I do now, and the bully pulpit that I have now, there’s never a time when I’m not screaming at GMs who feel they don’t need to make themselves available in a crisis with their team, like Bryan Colangelo, who’s become invisible the last six months. I feel like I have this forum, and it’s my responsibility to speak on behalf of all the media in the area and say this isn’t the way you do it in Philadelphia. So, yeah, in that regard we’re all on the team. But over the years, yeah, the team has its issues internally.

paragraphs.name: 690c
paragraphs.text: Great read. Pulling a lot of different viewpoints into a timeline is always a fun way to progress a story.

150704e04327.title: Oh my God, what an article.

paragraphs.name: 2a50
paragraphs.text: Oh my God, what an article. I laughed so many times I had tears in my eyes. It’s not just the rather bizarre realization that a team as insignificant as the Philadelphia Eagles would actually have 15–17 beat writers, but that said writers are trashing the press box so much they have to be ejected like frat boys at an all-night Denny’s. The…

71710de04d15.title: He says “Twitter is the worst”, but no — Elliot Shorr Parks is the worst.

paragraphs.name: dccf
paragraphs.text: He says “Twitter is the worst”, but no — Elliot Shorr Parks is the worst.

2956e3270d45.title: Shorter, alternate oral history: “These jerks were so loud that others were complaining, so I asked…

paragraphs.name: ee78
paragraphs.text: Shorter, alternate oral history: “These jerks were so loud that others were complaining, so I asked them to quiet down. King Jerk then gave me a dose of entitled attitude, so I ran his a**.”

bc9352ee38fc.title: Great read, Gonzo!! Miss you on PST (or whatever it was called last you were on) tho.

paragraphs.name: e0da
paragraphs.text: Great read, Gonzo!! Miss you on PST (or whatever it was called last you were on) tho.

36b8401416c9.title: Great piece, but let get things straight.

paragraphs.name: 627c
paragraphs.text: Great piece, but let get things straight. When it’s the Dolphins Ofensive Line being “bullies” and disfunctional, then we discuss jock culture, steroids, sports violence… when it’s sportswriters fighting and being loud and crazy , then it’s a “boys will be boys” situation and it’s all good clean fun?

paragraphs.name: 29ed
paragraphs.text: Time to stop passing judgement?

a617b5168d20.title: That’s really the best way to professionally relate to the public.

paragraphs.name: 4b90
paragraphs.text: That’s really the best way to professionally relate to the public.

virtuals.subtitle: However, how long until everyone notices these guys come off as entitled jerks?

content.subtitle: However, how long until everyone notices these guys come off as entitled jerks?

paragraphs.text: This is a fantastic piece. I’ve never read anything that captures the psychology of the Philly sports writing scene so perfectly. Good job, JG.

paragraphs.name: 05aa
paragraphs.text: However, how long until everyone notices these guys come off as entitled jerks?

paragraphs.name: b023
paragraphs.text: At some point, will the Eagles organization respond to this bizarre event? Or do they assume it will be quickly forgotten, just like the Eagles’ season?

624f7fc494b2.title: Agreed with the Grantland Rice / no forced narrative or angle thing.

content.subtitle: So, readers, which shade do you paint it, and why? Domineering big-money sports organization bullies writer(s)? Why? Because that’s the…

paragraphs.name: d14b
paragraphs.text: Agreed with the Grantland Rice / no forced narrative or angle thing. I would say it’s hard to get a firm idea of what did or didn’t happen with this kind of fragmentary-quote approach, but that’s about all a person can do, and it gives the reader (says this ex-sportswriter) a good idea of what it’s like when a writer has to actually piece things…

cb139e566650.title: This is a really neat piece to read.

paragraphs.name: 0dbc
paragraphs.text: This is a really neat piece to read. It reminds me more of Grantland when y’all used to tell stories instead of trying to push a narrative.

db106396cd26.title: I’m probably way overthinking this, but I couldn’t help but notice how often the writers said words…

paragraphs.name: ac47
paragraphs.text: I’m probably way overthinking this, but I couldn’t help but notice how often the writers said words like “fraternity” and “brothers” when referencing their writing corps. I kind of feel like if it wasn’t Anne Gordon, a woman in this “man’s world,” but rather a man who came to kick McLane out, McLane and his piers wouldn’t have taken such umbrage…

paragraphs.name: 0b57
paragraphs.text: Nobody teamed up. You all clammed up and let McLane be ejected. There was no team. There was cowing to the authority of the Philadelphia Eagles. Period.

974a06f3943.title: So Les Bowen thought someone would be Spartacus and follow McLane out, but when it was suggested…

paragraphs.text: So Les Bowen thought someone would be Spartacus and follow McLane out, but when it was suggested that it would be OK, they all sat back down. That’s weak. If the media thought he shouldn’t have been thrown out, they all should have stood up and left with him. Real weak from all the other media members in that box.

cfc65b7e9f2.title: Screw meditation — I’m going to read this every day for the rest of my life.

paragraphs.name: 4e65
paragraphs.text: Screw meditation — I’m going to read this every day for the rest of my life.
